qas.question: What event is stated as a reason why the word heretic is used less often in modern times?
Who was the author of the short story "The Theologians"?
What subject does the question of who has a monopoly on spiritual truth regard?

plausible_answers.text: who has a monopoly on spiritual truth

qas.question: Who wrote about heresey in the Christian church?
What word has many modern meanings?

context: Perhaps due to the many modern negative connotations associated with the term <b6_0>heretic<b6_0/>, such as the <a0_0><b3_0>Spanish inquisition<b3_0/><a0_0/>, the term is used less often today. The subject of <a2_0>Christian heresy<a2_0/> opens up broader questions as to <b4_0>who has a monopoly on spiritual truth<b4_0/>, as explored by <a1_0><b5_0>Jorge Luis Borges<b5_0/><a1_0/> in the short story "The Theologians" within the compilation Labyrinths.
